title: Store went out of business, but I have store credit. What do I do?
question: My wife and I bought and returned furnature at Home Designs (formally in Roseville Galeria). We received store credit of over $600. I just found out the store has closed. How do I redeem my credit/money?
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy proof of claim,Credit,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt

Mr. Mashal is correct. You may not be able to redeem the store credit...it may be lost forever if the company that provided it went out of business and is in bankruptcy. As Mr. mashal correctly stated, you can file a "proof of claim" in their bankruptcy case, but it may cost more than its worth.

However, if the store closed but there are others, or if it is owned by a parent company, you may be able to still redeem that credit. You will need to research the company.

Do you know which person or legal entity operated that store? You need to find out the financial status of that person or entity. If this person or entity is still in business (perhaps at other locations) you can speak to them about using your store credit there. However, if they have gone bankrupt, you may need to file a "proof of claim" in the bankruptcy case and see what assets they may have available to pay off their claims (including your claim). You should immediately consult your own attorney to protect your legal rights.
